content: Yes, Muchmusic's themed music video blocks reflected a broader trend in the music industry during the 1990s and early 2000s. This was a time when music genres were becoming more fragmented, with new sub-genres emerging within existing genres such as alternative rock, rap, and electronic dance music. As a result, music fans began to seek out specific types of music and these themed blocks provided a way for fans to focus on their favorite sub-genres for a concentrated period of time. Additionally, this trend coincided with the rise of the internet, which gave fans greater access to music and allowed them to seek out genres and sub-genres that aligned with their personal tastes. Overall, the themed music video blocks reflected the growing diversity of musical styles and subcultures within the broader music industry at the time.
